Plain English Description: The mean is the average of a set of numbers, found by adding them up and dividing by how many there are.
The median is the middle number in a set of numbers when they are lined up from smallest to largest.
How spread out the data is from the mean
The square root of the variance
Roughly, Skew tells us if a set of numbers is lopsided, meaning more values are on one side than the other.
Roughly, Kurtosis shows if a set of numbers has very high or very low peaks
